name: Goofy Gallery 28
ideas: Host an awards ceremony for your appliances, complete with acceptance speeches you perform on their behalf. The toaster is humble, the blender is insufferably cocky.
Write a strongly-worded letter to your past self about the organizational choices made in the junk drawer. Demand answers about the mysterious rubber bands.
Create a documentary series about the civil unrest brewing between your left sock and its long-lost twin who may or may not be living behind the dryer.
Develop a conspiracy theory about why the same corner of your fitted sheet keeps popping off. Big Mattress is clearly involved.
Hold a job interview for a new houseplant. Ask tough questions about their five-year growth plan and whether they can handle the pressure of indirect sunlight.
Write a Yelp review of your own refrigerator from the perspective of disappointed leftovers who expected better accommodations.
Stage a heist movie where you dramatically retrieve the last piece of chocolate you hid from yourself three weeks ago.
Create a sports commentary for the race between your phone battery and your motivation to find the charger. Both are at 3%.
Write a peace treaty between your sleep schedule and your ability to scroll endlessly at 2 AM. Neither side is negotiating in good faith.
Host a talent show for your fingers where each one showcases their unique typing abilities. The pinky is the underdog story of the century.
Develop a nature documentary about the migratory patterns of your TV remote, which mysteriously travels between couch cushions without human intervention.
Create an elaborate origin story for the weird stain on your ceiling that you've been ignoring for two years.
Write a training manual for your future self on how to successfully navigate the fridge at 3 AM without waking up your entire evolutionary lineage.
Host a diplomatic summit between your bank account and your Amazon wishlist. Tensions are high, compromise is unlikely.
Compose a tragic opera about the ice cube that sacrificed itself for your room temperature beverage.
Create a stock portfolio tracking the fluctuating value of promises you've made to 'deal with that later.'
Write a nature documentary about the territorial warfare between your clean laundry pile and your dirty laundry pile. The chair is disputed territory.
Develop a reality TV pitch about the dramatic lives of your spice rack. The paprika has been there since 2014 and has stories to tell.
Host a mock intervention for your browser tabs. There are 47 of them. They miss being closed.
Write a heartfelt apology letter to your knees for all the times you stood up weird and made them pop ominously.
Create a weather forecast for the microclimate zones in your bedroom. It's freezing by the window, tropical under the blanket.
Develop a mythology explaining why your headphones tangle themselves in your pocket despite the laws of physics.
Host a presidential debate between your responsible adult side and your 'one more episode' side. There will be no winner.
Write a cookbook of recipes you've invented at 1 AM using only the random items left in your pantry. Chapter 3: Cereal Innovations.
Create a dramatic retelling of the time you waved back at someone who wasn't waving at you. This is your villain origin story.
Develop a training regimen for competitive shower arguments with people who wronged you seven years ago. You're getting better at the comebacks.
Write a property listing for the corner of your room where you've been throwing clothes. Prime location, flexible square footage.
Host an Olympic-style competition between your streaming service algorithms to see which one knows you least well.
Create a genealogy chart for the generations of half-used chapsticks that have accumulated in various jacket pockets.
Write a thriller novel about the mysterious noise your apartment makes at 3 AM that you've chosen to simply normalize.
Develop a loyalty rewards program for your snooze button. You've earned platinum status and frankly should receive a trophy.
Host a TED Talk delivered by your most judgmental houseplant about what it's witnessed in this household.
Create an archaeological expedition journal documenting what you find between your couch cushions. The 2019 coin is a significant find.
Write a dating profile for your WiFi router. It's emotionally unavailable and disappears when you need it most.
Develop a support group meeting script for all the tabs you opened for 'research' that are still open three months later.
Host a roast of yourself but only using things your pets have witnessed and silently judged you for.
Create a dramatic movie trailer for the epic journey of walking to the kitchen and forgetting why you went there.
Write a nature documentary about the complex mating rituals of socks in the wild, and why some never find their match.
Develop a morning news program covering the breaking events inside your refrigerator. The yogurt is two days past expiration and making bold claims.
Host a mock ceremony inducting your oldest t-shirt into the Hall of Fame for clothes you'll never throw away despite the holes.
Create a detailed exit interview with your motivation asking why it left and whether it plans to ever return.
Write a dramatic saga about the territorial expansion of the one drawer in your house that slowly absorbs everything.
Develop a documentary about the ghost of your gym membership, still auto-renewing, waiting for your return.
Host a wine and cheese pairing but with different types of instant noodles and whatever cheese you have that isn't moldy yet.
Create a conspiracy board connecting all the times you've said 'I should really fix that' to things that remain unfixed.
Write a superhero origin story for the one Tupperware lid that actually matches a container in your cabinet.
Develop a mock courtroom drama prosecuting yourself for crimes against your houseplants committed through neglect and overwatering.
Host a memorial service for your productive day that died the moment you decided to take a 'quick break' at noon.
Create an investigative podcast about who keeps using the last of the toilet paper without replacing the roll. The prime suspect lives alone.
Write a strongly-worded cease and desist letter to the sun for coming through your window at the exact angle that hits your eyes every morning.
Compose a strongly-worded resignation letter from your left sock to your right sock citing irreconcilable differences in warmth distribution.
Host an awards ceremony for the bravest crumb that survived the Great Countertop Wiping of this morning.
Create a nature documentary narrating the migration patterns of your hair ties from where you put them to where they mysteriously end up.
Write a self-help book from the perspective of your snooze button titled 'Boundaries: Why Nine Minutes Is Never Enough'.
Develop a reality TV pitch following the dramatic lives of the items perpetually stuck in your couch cushions.
Host a mock intervention for your browser tabs. There are 47 of them. They need help.
Create a historical epic about the Great Spoon Shortage during that week you kept putting off doing dishes.
Write a TED Talk from the perspective of the one pen that actually works in your junk drawer.
Develop a fitness program designed by and for your pajamas, who haven't seen the inside of a drawer in months.
Host a spelling bee where all the words are things you've confidently mispronounced your entire life.
Create a conspiracy theory about where all your bobby pins go and why the Hair Illuminati is suppressing this information.
Write a Shakespearean tragedy about the last ice cube that sacrificed itself for your lukewarm beverage.
Develop a mock archaeological dig analyzing the strata of items on your bedside table like ancient civilizations.
Host a press conference where you formally apologize to your future self for what you're about to eat at 2 AM.
Create a fantasy map of your home where the couch is labeled 'Here Be Dragons' and the kitchen is 'The Perilous Journey'.
Write an epic poem about the charging cable that only works if you hold it at a 37-degree angle while praying.
Develop a dating profile for your loneliest houseplant. It's looking for someone who remembers to water.
Host a mock summit between your to-do list and your actual productivity levels. Tensions are high.
Create a nature documentary about the apex predator in your home: the corner of the coffee table that attacks your pinky toe.
Write a memoir from the perspective of the shopping bag full of other shopping bags that has achieved sentience.
Develop a stock ticker tracking the volatile market of your willingness to cook versus order takeout.
Host a roast of your alarm clock, but it gets the last laugh because you still won't wake up.
Create a soap opera about the forbidden romance between your bed and your ambitions to wake up early.
Write a strongly-worded letter of complaint to whoever designed the human need to eat three whole times a day.
Develop a documentary series about the lost civilization of things you put 'somewhere safe' and never saw again.
Host a mock auction for the priceless artifact that is the rubber band ball you've been building since 2019.
Create a weather forecast for the climate inside your blanket fort. Conditions are cozy with a chance of snacks.
Write a hero's journey narrative for yourself walking to the mailbox and back. The dragon is social anxiety.
Develop a mock true crime podcast investigating who keeps leaving cabinet doors open. You know it's you. It's always you.
Host a talent show where you perform all the skills you've lied about having on your resume.
Create a nature documentary about the territorial wars between your apps fighting for notification dominance.
Write a peace treaty between your stomach and your eyes at a buffet. Neither side will honor it.
Develop a mock therapy session between yourself and your credit card after online shopping at midnight.
Host a championship tournament ranking the scariest sounds your house makes at 3 AM.
Create a documentary about the one lightbulb that's been 'about to burn out' for three years and counting.
Write a ballad honoring the brave leftovers that have waited patiently in the back of your fridge for their moment that will never come.
Develop a mock United Nations summit for all the different 'yous' that exist depending on who you're talking to.
Host an exhibition of modern art consisting entirely of your attempts to draw things from memory.
Create a mock trial where you prosecute your past self for purchases that present you has to deal with.
Write a nature documentary about the elaborate courtship ritual you perform before answering an unexpected phone call.
Develop a fake infomercial for a product that helps you remember what you were about to Google before you forgot.
Host a candlelit vigil for all the witty comebacks you thought of six hours too late.
Create a mock corporate meeting where all attendees are the different personality traits fighting for dominance.
Write an acceptance speech for the award of 'Best Performance of Looking Busy When the Boss Walks By'.
Develop a wildlife documentary about the endangered species known as 'matching socks in the wild'.
Host a mock cooking show where you rate your own meal prep attempts with the disappointment of a Michelin chef.
Create a dramatic reenactment of the time you waved back at someone who wasn't waving at you.
Write a fantasy novel prologue for the epic quest of finding the TV remote that is definitely in this room somewhere.
Develop a mock sports commentary for the intense battle between you and a jar lid that refuses to open.
Host an inauguration ceremony for the new roll of toilet paper, celebrating the peaceful transfer of power from its predecessor.
Host an awards ceremony for the bravest notification you ignored today. The winner gets permanently dismissed.
Write a dramatic monologue from the perspective of the ice cube tray, bitter about never being refilled properly.
Create a mock diplomatic summit between your work self and your home self to negotiate weekend territory.
Develop a nature documentary about the migratory patterns of your reading glasses across various flat surfaces.
Hold a formal intervention for your browser tabs. There are 47 of them and they need to talk about boundaries.
Write the origin story of the mysterious stain on your ceiling that you've named Gerald.
Host a mock press conference addressing the scandal of who keeps leaving cabinet doors slightly open.
Create a detailed conspiracy theory about why one sock always escapes the dryer. The evidence is mounting.
Develop a training program for your eyebrows to stop expressing your true feelings in meetings.
Write a Shakespearean tragedy about the phone charger that only works at one specific angle.
Host a mock archaeological dig through your coat pockets. Document each receipt and lint ball as precious artifacts.
Create a motivational speech delivered by your alarm clock explaining why it believes in you despite everything.
Develop a mock true crime podcast investigating who ate the last slice of pizza. You know who it was.
Write a retirement party speech for the pen that finally ran out of ink after years of faithful service.
Host a mock talent show where household objects compete. The squeaky door has been practicing.
Create a nature documentary about the apex predator in your home: the corner of the coffee table that targets shins.
Develop a mock therapy session between your ambitions and your Netflix queue. Progress is unlikely.
Write an epic poem about the heroic journey of a crumb that traveled from the toaster to the floor.
Host a mock auction for your collection of plastic bags inside other plastic bags. Bidding starts at one confused sigh.
Create a weather forecast for the emotional climate of your group chat. Storms expected.
Develop a mock congressional hearing investigating the disappearance of all your hair ties.
Write a coming-of-age story from the perspective of the avocado that ripened perfectly while you weren't home.
Host a mock reality show elimination for which streaming service subscription survives this month.
Create a formal complaint letter to your past self about the mystery leftovers now claiming sentience in the fridge.
Develop a mock sports draft for picking which household chore you'll actually complete today.
Write a war documentary about the ongoing conflict between your fitted sheet and the mattress corner.
Host a mock spelling bee using only the increasingly unhinged passwords you've created over the years.
Create a nature documentary about the territorial behavior of half-empty water glasses on your nightstand.
Develop a mock TED talk on your groundbreaking research into why you're tired despite doing nothing.
Write a strongly worded letter from your future self about the 3am decisions current you keeps making.
Host a mock fashion week featuring outfits you've worn while working from home. The bar is underground.
Create a mock escape room based on trying to leave your house on time. No one has ever solved it.
Develop a historical epic about the Great Coffee Spill of this morning and the civilizations it destroyed on your desk.
Write a mock product recall notice for the promises you made to yourself on Sunday nights.
Host a mock Olympic event for competitive procrastination. You've been training your whole life.
Create a nature documentary about the symbiotic relationship between you and the snooze button.
Develop a mock courtroom drama about prosecuting the person who decided 'reply all' should exist.
Write a ghost story narrated by the Tupperware lid that vanished into another dimension.
Host a mock United Nations peacekeeping mission in your junk drawer. Tensions are high.
Create a mock investment portfolio tracking the value of your various anxieties. The market is bullish.
Develop a training montage for the intense workout of getting out of bed when it's cold.
Write a mock nature special about the elaborate camouflage techniques of your to-do list items.
Host a mock awards show for the best excuses you've crafted to avoid social events. The competition is fierce.
Create a mock archaeological timeline of the layers of stuff accumulating on your chair that isn't a closet.
Develop a mock hostage negotiation with the pillow that's taken your motivation captive.
Write a mock travel documentary exploring the vast wilderness between your bed and the bathroom at 3am.
Host a mock intervention for your plants about their concerning lack of effort to stay alive.
Create a mock mission briefing for Operation: Find Something to Watch in Under 45 Minutes.
Develop a mock sports rivalry between the urge to be productive and the gravitational pull of your bed.
Write a mock acceptance speech for the award of 'Most Creative Excuse for Not Texting Back Immediately'.
Compose a formal declaration of independence from your alarm clock. Cite grievances including 'cruel and unusual timing' and 'repeated violations of sacred sleep treaties'.
Develop a mock heist movie plot for stealing the last slice of pizza before your roommate notices. Assemble your crew: the lookout, the distraction, the grabber.
Write performance reviews for each of your toes. Some are clearly not pulling their weight around here.
Host a mock parole hearing for the leftovers that have been in the fridge long enough to develop their own consciousness.
Create a genealogy chart tracing the lineage of the miscellaneous cords in your drawer. Who are their ancestors? What do they connect?
Develop a mock wildlife rescue operation for the lone chip at the bottom of the bag that's been through too much.
Write a dramatic monologue from the perspective of your phone at 3% battery, knowing the end is near.
Host a mock spelling bee using only the weird noises you make when you're home alone.
Create a mock insurance claim for the emotional damage caused by stepping on a Lego.
Develop a mock witness protection program for the snack you're hiding from your family.
Write a strongly worded letter to past you about the decisions that led to present you's current predicament.
Host a mock reality TV confessional about your complicated relationship with the gym membership you've used twice.
Create a mock archaeological dig of your bag, documenting each artifact layer by layer. The receipt from 2019 is a significant find.
Develop a mock weather forecast for the emotional climate of your next family gathering.
Write a mock mission impossible script for the dangerous journey of walking past someone you vaguely recognize in public.
Host a mock draft where you select your outfit components. Round one: the reliable jeans. Round two: that shirt that makes you feel things.
Create a mock UN resolution addressing the ongoing conflict between your desire to be healthy and the existence of cheese.
Develop a backstory for the pen that mysteriously appeared in your possession. Where did it come from? What secrets does it hold?
Write a mock pilot episode script for a sitcom set entirely in your freezer. The ice cube trays have beef.
Host a mock press conference addressing the rumors that you have no idea what you're doing. The rumors are accurate.
Create a mock escape room challenge using only the obstacles between you and a productive morning.
Develop a mock spy dossier on the neighbor you've waved to for three years but never learned the name of.
Write a mock training manual for the complex art of looking busy when your boss walks by.
Host a mock celebrity roast for your reflection. It's been a long year for both of you.
Create a mock true crime podcast investigating who keeps putting empty containers back in the fridge. The evidence points to you.
Develop a mock United Nations interpreter translating between what you said, what you meant, and what they heard.
Write a mock job application for the position of Professional Procrastinator. List your extensive qualifications.
Host a mock nature documentary about the mating rituals of your mismatched socks desperately seeking their partners.
Create a mock therapy session between your past self's ambitions and your current self's Netflix queue.
Develop a mock space mission log documenting the vast emptiness between your intentions and your actions.
Write a mock sports broadcast of you racing to look like you weren't just napping before someone knocked.
Host a mock TED talk about the philosophy of 'I'll start tomorrow' and its impact on human civilization.
Create a mock product recall notice for the personality trait you no longer wish to support.
Develop a mock Nobel Prize acceptance speech for your groundbreaking work in looking at your phone to avoid eye contact.
Write a mock survival guide for making it through a conversation where you forgot someone's name 47 seconds ago.
Host a mock diplomatic summit between your work self and your home self. Negotiations are tense.
Create a mock championship trophy for the world record you hold in convincing yourself one more episode is fine.
Develop a mock wildlife documentary about the rare species of motivation spotted briefly on Monday morning before going extinct.
Write a mock airline safety demonstration for the emotional turbulence of reading old text messages.
Host a mock home renovation show where you dramatically reveal what's been living behind the couch cushions.
Create a mock court transcript of the trial deciding whether the noise you heard at night was a ghost or just the house settling.
Develop a mock Olympic commentary for the athletic feat of reaching the remote without getting up.
Write a mock constitutional amendment protecting your right to stand in front of the open fridge hoping new food appears.
Host a mock auction for the privilege of being the first to break awkward silences at dinner parties.
Create a mock nature reserve for the endangered species of 'free time' and its shrinking natural habitat.
Develop a mock military operation plan for successfully sneaking snacks into the movie theater.
Write a mock origin story for your signature move of agreeing to plans then immediately regretting it.
Host a mock peace summit between the part of you that wants to socialize and the part that cancelled plans to hang with your cat.
Create a mock ASMR video of the satisfying sounds of finally cleaning that one spot you've been avoiding.
Develop a mock conspiracy theory about who keeps moving things to places you definitely didn't put them. Spoiler: it's you.
